channel.title: Supervisions on Henrik Røed Sherling
channel.description: Recent content in Supervisions on Henrik Røed Sherling

item.title: Ethics
item.description: Must we be motivated to act morally by moral requirements? Readings for these are roughly the same as in the lecture slides: 1 Moral psychology Question Does someone without a desire to be good have any reason to be good? Readings Michael Smith, The Moral Problem (Chapters 1, 3, 4) Brink, ‘Moral Motivation’ Bernard Williams, ‘Internal and External Reasons’ 2 Consent Can you consent to a medical treatment you don’t understand?

item.title: Philosophy of Mind
item.description: 1 Intentionality The first essay question is Do thermostats have beliefs? This is to be answered with reference to the following articles: Dennett, ‘Intentional systems’ Searle, ‘Minds, Brains, and Computers’ Haugeland, ‘Understanding: Dennett and Searle’
